update.description:
This is very much a work in progress. 

The goal is to parse `<frame>` elements and support computation of an element's pose in a given frame.  This pull request will be limited to models, links, collisions, and visuals. Additional pull requests will handle other elements. This work will eventually address issue #200.

What remains to be finished:

1. Need more tests, especially failure cases.
2. Update documentation.
3. Test and fix model renaming, which is done when a model is `<included>`.  A problem will arise if a model is renamed, but a frame inside the model refers to the original model name.

I should also mention that I'm not happy with the structure of the code. In particular how the frame graph class is passed around between objects. A more elegant solution will likely require a fairly major restructuring. Ideas are welcome.
update.title: Pose dom

content.raw: I'll see if I can get this done over the course of next week.
content.html: I'll see if I can get this done over the course of next week.

content.raw: do you want me to take over this work?
content.html: do you want me to take over this work?

content.raw: Yes, this is ready for review.
content.html: Yes, this is ready for review.

content.raw: IRL discussion: I'll look into producing an error if an frame graph is not present during load. Currently ign-physics and ign-gazebo do no directly call Load, at least that is the current working theory. So, this PR shouldn't those two libraries.
content.html: IRL discussion: I'll look into producing an error if an frame graph is not present during load. Currently ign-physics and ign-gazebo do no directly call Load, at least that is the current working theory. So, this PR shouldn't those two libraries.

content.raw:
Both ign-gazebo and ign-physics use sdf8. This PR goes to sdformat default which is version7. So, I don't think this will break anyone until we merge it into the gz11 branch on sdformat. 

We can also make another sdf8 prerelease before merging  sdfomat default into the gz11 branch so that ign-gazebo and ign-physics can run CI against debs while we update their code bases.

I could also be overlooking something here.
content.html:
Both ign-gazebo and ign-physics use sdf8. This PR goes to sdformat default which is version7. So, I don't think this will break anyone until we merge it into the gz11 branch on sdformat.

We can also make another sdf8 prerelease before merging sdfomat default into the gz11 branch so that ign-gazebo and ign-physics can run CI against debs while we update their code bases.

I could also be overlooking something here.

content.raw: if you change your mind, I've added the default values in pull request #487
content.html: if you change your mind, I've added the default values in pull request #487

content.raw:
we are allowed to break it, but we are using these classes in ign-physics and ign-gazebo, so it will break them once we merge this forward. we can fix them; I'm just trying to make that transition easier.

unless you think the API is way better this way, in case that's fine we'll deal with it
content.html:
we are allowed to break it, but we are using these classes in ign-physics and ign-gazebo, so it will break them once we merge this forward. we can fix them; I'm just trying to make that transition easier.

unless you think the API is way better this way, in case that's fine we'll deal with it

content.raw: SDF6 does not contain the DOM classes. I think that means we can make these changes without worrying about API breakage.
content.html: SDF6 does not contain the DOM classes. I think that means we can make these changes without worrying about API breakage.

content.raw: could we say: "An edge with a value of -1 connects from the parent to the child, and the edge with value of +1 connects from the child to the parent."
content.html: could we say: "An edge with a value of -1 connects from the parent to the child, and the edge with value of +1 connects from the child to the parent."

content.raw: this breaks API; do we want to give this a default value of `nullptr` to preserve API?
content.html: this breaks API; do we want to give this a default value of nullptr to preserve API?

content.raw: so this is ready for review?
content.html: so this is ready for review?

content.raw: TRI needs this, and they can't use bionic. I'll change this to use a mechanism other than std::optional.
content.html: TRI needs this, and they can't use bionic. I'll change this to use a mechanism other than std::optional.

content.raw: I've updated the dependencies to require c++17.
content.html: I've updated the dependencies to require c++17.

content.raw: `std::optional` is from c++17. A lot of the CI is failing because this is targeting `default` (c++11) instead of `gz11` (c++17). Should this branch be retargeted to gz11?
content.html: std::optional is from c++17. A lot of the CI is failing because this is targeting default (c++11) instead of gz11 (c++17). Should this branch be retargeted to gz11?

content.raw:
I like that proposal. I made one extra comment about how nested models could be handled:

* https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/35740/Gazebo+X?focusedCommentId=555745281#comment-555745281
content.html:
I like that proposal. I made one extra comment about how nested models could be handled:

  • https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/35740/Gazebo+X?focusedCommentId=555745281#comment-555745281

content.raw:
I’d really recommend considering the URI scheme that I proposed [in the comments](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/35740/Gazebo+X?focusedCommentId=477822977#comment-477822977). I’m pretty sure it would make it **very** simple to parse the frame input strings, and also be more short and concise for users who are writing SDF files.

If we’re open to considering that scheme I’d be happy to whip up an implementation and open a PR.
content.html:
I’d really recommend considering the URI scheme that I proposed in the comments. I’m pretty sure it would make it very simple to parse the frame input strings, and also be more short and concise for users who are writing SDF files.

If we’re open to considering that scheme I’d be happy to whip up an implementation and open a PR.

content.raw: this may be out of scope for now, but I think it's important to consider
content.html: this may be out of scope for now, but I think it's important to consider

there's some here and more in the comments at the bottom

https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/35740/Gazebo+X#GazeboX-CoordinateFrameRepresentation

there's some here and more in the comments at the bottom

content.raw: I believe we talked a bit about namespacing in one of our design documents about the sdformat pose graph, based on the hierarchical structure of the sdf file. Otherwise, I think all sdf elements with poses need unique names?
content.html: I believe we talked a bit about namespacing in one of our design documents about the sdformat pose graph, based on the hierarchical structure of the sdf file. Otherwise, I think all sdf elements with poses need unique names?
